cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Port Arthur, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, then turning north across Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border between Sea Rim State Park TX and Cameron LA (around the Port Arthur / Johnson Bayou area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX (includes Galveston Bay entrance)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast including Galveston Bay and southwest Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) likely Wednesday evening through early Thursday; hurricane-force winds unlikely at the port itself.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel, especially around high tide late Wednesday night.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–8 inches of rain possible, with localized higher amounts, creating flash-flood risk across the port region Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and the potential for isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands could disrupt port operations.
